Ad Text:
Leading Australian services business requires an experienced Business Analyst to drive improvements across operational support functions.

As a Business Analyst your role will focus on analysing business processes, defining opportunities for optimisation, and supporting the delivery of scalable, data-driven solutions that enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve employee experience.

Key Responsibilities:

Analyse, define, and implement improvements to end-to-end processes across business support functions.
Develop and implement a Standard Operating Model to drive efficiency, scalability, and consistency.
Work closely with stakeholders to capture requirements, assess current processes, and recommend optimised solutions.
Support delivery of enhanced policies, processes, and performance frameworks.
Provide insights through process mapping, workflow analysis, and reporting.
To succeed in this role, you will have:

A strong background in Business Analysis within operational / administrative support functions.
Experience across Finance, Commercial, and Risk preferred.
Proficiency with Business Analysis and process mapping tools (e.g., Visio, Lucidchart, Power BI).
Proven ability to work with stakeholders across multiple business areas.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on scalable, repeatable solutions.
The ability to work on site 4 - 5 days a week.
Public transport is a 5 minute walk away.

Please call Patrick Egan @ TalentWeb on 0407 261 441 for a Confidential Conversation or just hit the apply button below.

Let's talk about the role:

The Planning & Performance Specialist will partner closely with frontline leaders and cross-functional teams to drive alignment, execution, and uplift across customer-facing operations. The role will combine business planning, project management and capability enablement with a focus on performance improvement, process design, and customer experience.

Key Accountabilities
1. Business & Performance Planning
• Lead the annual and quarterly business planning process for the function.
• Align operational priorities with strategic goals, ensuring frontline and leadership teams have clarity on objectives, measures, and success outcomes.
• Track progress against KPIs, identify variances, and recommend interventions.
2. Project & Program Management
• Manage cross-functional projects that impact customer-facing operations, ensuring milestones, risks, and deliverables are clearly defined and delivered.
• Drive alignment and engagement with stakeholders, including frontline teams, to support smooth adoption of change.
• Develop and maintain project reporting and communication rhythms for leadership visibility.
3. Capability Development & Training
• Design and deliver training modules and playbooks to build operational and leadership capability across customer-facing teams.
• Support embedding of performance frameworks, coaching tools, and new ways of working.
• Facilitate workshops, learning sessions, and continuous improvement forums.
4. Process & Experience Design
• Map and analyse key processes across frontline operations to identify opportunities for simplification, automation, and uplift.
• Apply Human-Centred Design (HCD) and UX principles to create experiences that are simple, seamless, and effective for both employees and customers.
• Partner with digital and product teams to align process changes with technology enablement.
5. Analytics & Insights
• Translate operational and customer data into actionable insights to inform planning, decision-making, and performance improvements.
• Build dashboards, reports, and performance reviews that make metrics visible and drive accountability.
• Use trend analysis to proactively identify risks and opportunities.

Let's talk about you:

Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

Understanding of project management principles and methodologies.

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills with ability to simplify complex ideas.

Ability to work autonomously and apply independent decision making and problem solving

Proficiency in project management software and tools with a high attention to detail.

Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now! We commit to respond to every applicant.

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Development New Business and Structured Products
Ad Text:
More than 50 years ago a foundation was laid, with a vision for the future. To re-imagine the environments where Australians would live, work and grow. In this time, Mirvac has evolved from a small joint venture to a thriving ASX-listed property group, leading in sustainability, innovation, safety, and placemaking.

Mirvac has created some of Australia's most iconic places, from thriving residential communities, to landmark offices and mixed-use precincts. At the heart of every project: a deep commitment to our customers, and an ambition to reimagine urban life.

At Mirvac, we know that it's our people, their passion and expertise and the exceptional experiences we create for our audience, that defines us.

Our opportunity

We have an opportunity for a Senior Analyst, New Business & Structured Transactions to join our team. You will primarily support the Commercial & Mixed-use New Business function (predominantly mixed use development commercial and living orientated developments) as well as supporting the Product Origination and Structured Projects or Build to Rent New Business Analyst team as required, to facilitate the growth of development pipeline.

The Commercial & Mixed-use New Business function is an integral part of Mirvac, tasked with replenishing Mirvac's large development pipeline and converting new projects in preparation for delivery. The Product Origination and Structured Projects team secures new capital sources to assist in the delivery of Mirvac's development pipeline and investment strategies.

Your responsibilities will include:


Build and maintain financial models underpinning new business opportunities and investment strategies. This includes building development and investment models, running various scenarios as well as different transaction structures to test different strategies and producing succinct summaries of the results.
Ensure that each financial model is logic and in line with industry practice
Keep abreast of market developments, valuation assumptions and practices as well as key underwrite assumptions
Drive optimisation of the financial outcomes, assessing options and recommending strategies which underpin value and achieve a "highest and best use" analysis and best-case scenarios
Understanding of cash and capital impacts of all major decisions and investments
Ensure modelling is undertaken in a manner consistent with the proposed transaction structures
Research and analyse data to support underlying assumptions
Prepare competitor analyses and market intelligence reports

Your point of difference

You will be professionally qualified with demonstrated experience working as an Analyst within the property industry, preferably within a development or investments environment. You will have a strong capability building, amending and testing of financial models and experience working with large datasets and preparing reports and presentations.

You will be a strong communicator, with well developed analytical and problem solving skills as well as a self-motivated and inquisitive nature who thrives building and developing stakeholder relationships.

All of these attributes are preferred, if you think you may be the right fit for the role please still apply.
